required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quelling of Excitotoxicity in Acute Stroke With Ketamine
clinical_study.official_title: Quelling of Excitotoxicity in Acute Stroke With Ketamine

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators plan to undertake a phase II study to investigate the efficacy and side effects of intravenous ketamine to reduce neuroexcitotoxicity, and thus provide neuroprotection in patients diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: After obtaining informed consent, patients enrolled in the 'study drug' arm of the trial will receive Ketamine (1 mg/ml solution prepared in normal saline) infusion at a rate of 40 mg/h for a period of 48 hours. The infusion will start at a rate of 10 mg/h, and then gradually tapered up during the first 3 hours by 10 mg an hour. Similarly, the infusion rate will be gradually tapered down at a rate of 10 mg/h during the last 3 hours of infusion. The patients randomized to the 'placebo arm' of the trial will receive normal saline infusion at the same rates. In order to prevent the psychogenic adverse effects associated with Ketamine, the patients will be administered Midazolam at a dose of 1 mg IV every 4 hours. Midazolam will also be administered at the same rate to the patients randomized to the placebo arm. Blood Ketamine levels will be measured before starting the treatment, and daily while the infusion is on. While receiving treatment, the patients will be admitted to the telemetry floor in the hospital, on a monitored bed.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in weighted modified Rankin scale score between day 1 and 90 will be assessed.
primary_outcome.description: An improvement of 2 in mRS score will be considered favorable outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: An improvement of 10 or more points in Barthel's index will be considered a favorable outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On day 1, day 4 or discharge whichever is earlier, and at 90 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression score using the PHQ9 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On day 1, and day 4 or discharge whichever is earlier.
On day 1, and day 4 or discharge whichever is earlier
secondary_outcome.description: Measured from the DWI-MRI and/or CT images

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4 or discharge whichever is earlier
Up to day 4 or discharge whichever is earlier
secondary_outcome.description: Increase of 4 or more points in the NIH stroke scale

arm_group.description: Will receive Ketamine infusion, and Midazolam (Versed).
Will receive Normal saline infusion and Midazolam (Versed).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. All patients who are 18 years or older, presenting or admitted to the Doylestown Hospital with acute ischemic stroke, up to 24 hours since their last known well time
2. An MRI evidence of acute ischemic infarct on the diffusion-weighted imaging with ADC correlate
3. Pre-stroke modified Rankin scale of 0-2
4. Patient should be willing to participate in the study by providing a written consent himself/herself or through a proxy.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Eligibility to receive IV alteplase or intra-arterial thrombectomy/embolectomy
2. Longer than 24 hours since last known well time
3. Pre-stroke modified Rankin scale of 3 or above.
4. Pregnant or lactating females
5. Pre-existing psychiatric illness
6. Intracranial hemorrhage of any type at presentation
7. Seizure at onset of symptoms
8. Inability/refusal to provide consent by the patient or through a proxy
